lead_paragraph: State wildlife officials suspended recreation along almost 200 miles of the Yellowstone River last week to prevent a parasite from spreading.

headline.print_headline: A Parasite Deadly to Fish  Shuts a Montana River
headline.main: Tiny Invader, Deadly to Fish, Shuts Down a River in Montana

snippet: State wildlife officials suspended recreation along almost 200 miles of the Yellowstone River last week to prevent a parasite from spreading....
abstract: Montana wildlife officials shut down nearly 200 miles of Yellowstone River and several of its tributaries to all recreational activities in effort to prevent parasite that is killing local fish from spreading into other rivers or into Yellowstone National Park; river is one of Montana's most popular fly-fishing destinations and decision has left outfitters reeling.
